=== Roadmap ===

Many points of this road map was discussed in irc meetings and in the mailing list (some pointers <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-tn/2008-May/000449.html|here]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-tn/2008-May/000473.html|here]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-tn/2008-June/000501.html|here]]</nowiki>).

We have 7 work groups, each one have its planning.

 1. '''Secretary'''
*** Federate all the groups to work together in harmony.
*** Define and explain the community rules.
*** Archive and manage the all meetings reports and documents.
*** Keep safe the community assets.
 1. '''Relationships with companies'''
*** SIB 2008 exposition, (biggest computer exposition in Tunisia) Nov 08: propose to local manufacturers to use Ubuntu.
*** Build database of Tunisian companies that can offer sponsoring.
*** Periodically visit databased companies.
 1. '''Relationships with universities'''
*** Encourage using of ubuntu in universities
*** Contact students groups and clubs to present ubuntu as an alternative and complete OS
 1. '''International relationships'''
*** Ensure contact with the LoCoCouncil, the CommunityCouncil and other LoCo Teams (especially, the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-fr|French Team]]</nowiki>, the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-ma|Marrocan Team]]</nowiki> and the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ubuntu-jordan|Jordanian Team]]</nowiki>)
*** Collaborate and keep contact with the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/LoCoCouncilAgenda/talk|Ubuntu Arabic Team]]</nowiki>
 1. '''Events'''
*** ''SFD Tunisia 2008'' - we are invited by the organisation comity to participate to the SFD'2008. This event will be held after the Intrepid Ibex release. So we plan to present this new version with the new features.
*** Many Intrepid Ibex Install Party's are planed (FST Tunis, ISET Charguiya, ...).

 1. '''Web&Tech'''
*** Website ubuntu-tn.org : We already discussed the <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-tn/2008-June/000512.html|detailed sitemap]]</nowiki> on the <nowiki>[[http://logs.ubuntu-eu.org/free/2008/06/09/%23ubuntu-tn.html|June 9 2008 IRC meeting]]</nowiki>. The main elements are support forums, event calendar, documentation and planet. We are about beginning the development. It will be online in few weeks.
*** Wiki pages : Rewrite and reorganize Wiki pages related to TunisianTeam to make them more clear and user friendly.
*** IRC : Create our own bot with some user helping features.
*** Mirror : The Government is about offering our LoCo Team a local Ubuntu mirror, we will ensure its installation and maintenance.
 1. '''Redaction'''
*** Write all the content for our website.
*** Publish one article or more per month in a national press.
*** Maintain archives for the LoCo Team actions.

=== Experience ===

'''Events'''

* ''Install party Ubuntu 8.04'' <<BR>> Organization of an Install party and a presentation of Hardy features for the students of the "Institut Supérieur d'Etudes Technologiques" Charguiya - Tunisia (17 May 2007). [Announcement http://altn.tuxfamily.org/?action=display&id=75], Preparation and discussion on the mailing list <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-tn/2008-May/000459.html|in French]]</nowiki>.

* ''Install party Ubuntu 8.04'' <<BR>> Organization of an Install party and a presentation of Hardy features for the students of the "Institut Supérieur d'Informatique" Tunis - Tunisia in collaboration with another tunisian team "Free Ways" (30 April 2007). Preparation and discussion on the mailing list <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-tn/2008-April/000351.html|in French]]</nowiki>. The <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-tn/attachments/20080430/b60eb0d0/attachment-0001.pdf|event poster]]</nowiki>.

* ''SFD Tunisia 2007'' <<BR>> Participation in the Software Freedom Day 2007 (http://www.sfdtunisia.org) which was organized on 27 October 2007 on sciences city in Tunis. <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/TunisianTeam/sfd07|Team preparation]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://picasaweb.google.com/Nizar.Kerkeni/SFD07|photos]]</nowiki>.

* JLL 2007 (Journée du Logiciel Libre = OpenSource Software Day) organized in the Faculty of Science of Tunis.

* Journée informatique scolaire libre Menzeh 6.

* Conference about Ubuntu in "Mjez el Beb" city.

* Conference about Linux/Ubuntu in "Ras el Jbel" city by KarimFath. (<nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-tn/attachments/20080710/b01f689d/attachment-0001.pdf|Presentation]]</nowiki>).
